citations.narrative:
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC):
-The PVC states to administer Rabies vaccinations at 16 weeks of age and then 1 year of age. One male French Bulldog
(4418) and one female French Bulldog (4402) did not receive their first rabies vaccination until they were approximately
14 months old. Additionally, the PVC states that animals are to receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines (7-way) at 11
and 16 weeks of age, these animals did not receive this vaccine until about 6 months of age.
-The PVC states that all adults must receive a heartworm test each year. Records indicate that the last time heartworm
testing was performed was in February of 2024.
Failure to administer required vaccines and perform heartworm test sampling in accordance with a veterinary approved
schedule may result in animals to not be adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct
by ensuring all animals are vaccinated and tested in accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending
Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations
and when testing will be performed for these animals.

The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Medical records indicated that adult female
French Bulldog (9782) was overdue for the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations and adult female French Bulldog
(0054) was overdue for Distemper, Parvovirus, and Rabies vaccinations. The facility states that these animals were up to
date on these vaccinations but they did not record that information in the medical record.
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by November 14, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3)  Repeat
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the vaccination schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC): 
 
-The PVC states to administer Rabies vaccinations at 16 weeks of age and then 1 year of age. One male French Bulldog 
(4418) and one female French Bulldog (4402) did not receive their first rabies vaccination until they were approximately 
14 months old. Additionally, the PVC states that animals are to receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines (7-way) at 11 
and 16 weeks of age, these animals did not receive this vaccine until about 6 months of age.  
-The PVC states that all adults must receive a heartworm test each year. Records indicate that the last time heartworm 
testing was performed was in February of 2024.  
 
Failure to administer required vaccines and perform heartworm test sampling in accordance with a veterinary approved 
schedule may result in animals to not be adequately protected against disease and can cause pain and distress. Correct 
by ensuring all animals are vaccinated and tested in accordance with the schedule approved by the Attending 
Veterinarian and contact the Attending Veterinarian to create a plan to determine when to administer future vaccinations 
and when testing will be performed for these animals. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not maintain complete medical records for all animals. Medical records indicated that adult female 
French Bulldog (9782) was overdue for the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations and adult female French Bulldog 
(0054) was overdue for Distemper, Parvovirus, and Rabies vaccinations. The facility states that these animals were up to 
date on these vaccinations but they did not record that information in the medical record. 
 
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals 
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all 
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and 
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information.

This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by November 14, 2025 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
